description: Great app to organize notes in markdown format. Every note is an independent file within a folder. It can use tags. Simple but highly efficient. Developer updates it constantly taking into account feedback and bug reports.
Very effective UI, over all good features. Shame that it lacks support for GSuite / Google backend for tasks, storage of notes in GDrive etc.
Lots of options, sensible layout choices, nextcloud integration - fantastic
summary: This is the notepad I have been looking for

description: I used the .deb version from the repo for a long time and it worked fine. I decided to try out the flatpak version and it's glitchy and flickers quite a lot. It's almost like it doesn't update the video framebuffer because you'll click something, but it will still look like some other thing is higlighted until you move your mouse over it. It technically functions, but the .deb version is superior.
summary: The FlatPak Version Flickers a Lot

description: Spends ~200 mb memory, this is as high as an electron app which Linux community often bashes. IDK how it performs on KDE but don't try to use it on GNOME. Terrible UX and memory hog.

I like that it stores notes in plain text in a good folder format. Very customizable to get it just how you want it. Good NextCloud integration and works flawlessly with the NextCloud notes app on Android.
